{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3130380,"name":"Pulkith Paruchuri","username":"DespicableMonkey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/958977/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T05:07:11.798Z","cooked":"

Hey Everyone!

We recently bought and built the SDS mk4 swerve modules with NEOs. We are using a cancoder for steering.

However, we also wanted to add an encoder for the drive motor, so we could estimate our position on the field (in addition with the april tags). We weren’t sure how to mount encoders to the drive motor.

Does anyone have any recommendations on which encoders is to buy, and how to mount it to the drive motors?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T05:07:11.798Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":80,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":465.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Pulkith Paruchuri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52751,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3130391,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T05:26:12.093Z","cooked":"

The Neo has a built-in encoder. That’s the easiest way to go! It’s only 42 counts per revolution, but that will probably be sufficient.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T05:26:12.093Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":144.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/2","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130465,"name":"Roger","username":"RogerMCT","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rogermct/{size}/265955_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T13:35:09.158Z","cooked":"

I agree with @gdefender , use the RelativeEncoder built into the Neo. Here is the code usage…

SwerveTest/SwerveModule.java at main · FRCTeam5484/SwerveTest (github.com)

Sorry, I should have mentioned this, but we also wanted to use velocity PID with the encoders to drive autonomously to certain locations, and I saw that with the NEO encoder with the SparkMax added a 110ms delay that made it quite difficult to do this. Do you know if there’s any other way to accomplish this? (We were looking at adding a follower wheel, but are not sure effective this is).

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T15:25:41.053Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":38.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Pulkith Paruchuri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52751,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130526,"name":"Ari Steinfeld","username":"1712ControlSystemGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/1712controlsystemguy/{size}/212282_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T15:39:21.964Z","cooked":"

The delay hasn’t been an issue with my PID code that drives to a position

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T15:39:21.964Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Ari Steinfeld","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52751,"username":"DespicableMonkey","name":"Pulkith Paruchuri","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/958977/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42767,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PSU Ri3D, labview guru"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/5","custom_user_title":"PSU Ri3D, labview guru","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130572,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T16:35:50.710Z","cooked":"

The delay probably isn’t an issue for a drivetrain, but it has been configurable since firmware 1.6.0. I believe this is the method to set it: setAverageDepth

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T04:58:45.286Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://codedocs.revrobotics.com/java/com/revrobotics/relativeencoder#setAverageDepth(int)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"RelativeEncoder (FRC-REVLib API)","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52751,"username":"DespicableMonkey","name":"Pulkith Paruchuri","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/958977/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/6","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130922,"name":"Pulkith Paruchuri","username":"DespicableMonkey","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/958977/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T00:08:52.889Z","cooked":"

Thank you! We weren’t aware of that! We’ll try that out soon and let you know how it goes.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T00:08:52.889Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424001,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-encoder","display_username":"Pulkith Paruchuri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44380,"username":"gdefender","name":"Andy Gasser","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52751,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-encoder/424001/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131091,"name":"Ari Steinfeld","username":"1712ControlSystemGuy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/1712controlsystemguy/{size}/212282_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T04:11:31.962Z","cooked":"

I have labview odometry code that uses the neo encoders and it is fine. for a bit, our azimuth motors were controlled using the “position” set output mode, but then we switched to custom PID loops with the absolute encoders. the point is, the delay is not an issue, and from my testing I found it to be less than the 110ms delay. If I remember correctly, that is only for the velocity sensor, and if you use the position sensor you get less of a delay.
